newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS - North spends A$2 mln after bird deaths.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - North spends A$2 mln after bird deaths.

text.p: Mining and forestry group North Ltd said on Wednesday it had committed A$2 million to improve the environmental performance of its Northparkes copper and gold mine after 2,700 birds died in the mine's tailings dam last year.
The deaths of the birds occurred as a result of high levels of cyanide in the tailings dam, North said in a statement.
Cyanide is no longer used at the mine, the company said.
North said it was addressing key issues raised in an environmental audit released on Wednesday by the New South Wales state government.

"Although the report confirms that environmental management of the Northparkes mine is of a high standard and generally conforms to best practice, the audit found that procedural faults led to the bird deaths," North said.
"We recognise that mistakes were made and we accept responsibility for these mistakes."
North said that following the bird deaths, the company had committed A$2 million to alleviate the immediate problem and to fund longer-term problems.
North holds an 80 percent interest in Northparkes. The rest is owned by Sumitomo Corp.
